item.title: CMSO-transducing tree-like graph decompositions
item.description: arXiv:2412.04970v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that given a graph G we can CMSO-transduce its modular decomposition, its split decomposition and its bi-join decomposition. This improves results by Courcelle [Logical Methods in Computer Science, 2006] who gave such transductions using order-invariant MSO, a strictly more expressive logic than CMSO. Our methods more generally yield C2MSO-transductions of the canonical decomposition of weakly-partitive set systems and weakly-bipartitive systems of bipartitions.
item.dc:creator: Rutger Campbell, Bruno Guillon, Mamadou Moustapha Kant\'e, Eun Jung Kim, Noleen K\"ohler

item.title: Robust Almost-Sure Reachability in Multi-Environment MDPs
item.description: arXiv:2301.11296v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Multiple-environment MDPs (MEMDPs) capture finite sets of MDPs that share the states but differ in the transition dynamics. These models form a proper subclass of partially observable MDPs (POMDPs). We consider the synthesis of policies that robustly satisfy an almost-sure reachability property in MEMDPs, that is, one policy that satisfies a property for all environments. For POMDPs, deciding the existence of robust policies is an EXPTIME-complete problem. In this paper, we show that this problem is PSPACE-complete for MEMDPs, while the policies in general require exponential memory. We exploit the theoretical results to develop and implement an algorithm that shows promising results in synthesizing robust policies for various benchmarks.
item.dc:creator: Marck van der Vegt, Nils Jansen, Sebastian Junges
